titleStmt.title: Gilgame&c; and the bull of heaven -- a composite transliteration

publicationStmt.distributor: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature

address.addrLine: The Oriental Institute, University of Oxford, Pusey Lane, Oxford OX1 2LE, UK, email etcsl@orinst.ox.ac.uk, http://etcsl.orinst.ox.ac.uk

seriesStmt.p: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature aims to make accessible over 400 literary works composed in the Sumerian language in ancient Mesopotamia during the late third and early second millennia BC. The works are in Sumerian composite transliteration and English prose translation with bibliographical information on each composition.

bibl.biblScope: composite text, score transliteration, translation, photograph, commentary

bibl.note: Ur III, Me-Turan and Nibru versions

body.head: A version of unknown provenance, supplemented from Nibru mss.

l.note: Cited in OB catalogue from Nibru, at Philadelphia, 0.2.01, line 11; OB catalogue in the Louvre, 0.2.02, line 37; OB catalogue from Urim (U2), 0.2.04, line 11

div1.note: instead of approx. lines 52-54, 1 ms. has:
instead of approx. lines 64-67, a fourth ms. has:
It is uncertain if this segment belongs here.

body.head: Fragment of an earlier version from Nibru, dating to the Ur III period
